p: The disease in wildlife domestic herd and other animals is reportable to the OSV. However, better surveillance data for Toxoplasma in wildlife species is needed to understand the ecology of the disease in Alaska. Two diagnostic tests are available for T. gondii that can be used in various species of animals â€“ a molecular method (multiplex PCR) and a multi-species enzyme immunoassay (ELISA) that detects its antibodies in blood or tissue fluid. An absorbent filter paper method to collect blood from animals under field conditions for the diagnosis of T. gondii in wildlife is being developed ( 20, 21). This will simplify blood collection under Arctic conditions and facilitate sample collection by hunters.
